title: What technology do philosophies other than science create? - Quora

response.answer_text: As Coppedge correctly points out, science is not a philosophy. Science is a process for determining how reality works. Because reality exists, independent of our perception of it, science must be objective or it fails to properly describe reality. Example: “Anthropogenic climate change.” So if we modify the OP to read instead, “What technology do non-objective philosophies create?” then you have your answer:  When non-objectively determined theories are not readily accepted because there is no underlying science, the above is ALWAYS the answer.

You may want to look into Engineering. Nearly everything sufficiently advanced is engineered nowadays. Engineering is kind of applied science, but it’s more using your intuition and foundations to design it. There’s prototyping, etc. There is no science being done here. But it does use science.
